import React, { useState } from 'react'; import Navbar from '../components/Navbar'; function Profile() { // Mock user data - in a real app, this would come from an API or context const [user, setUser] = useState(() => { const savedUser = localStorage.getItem('user'); return savedUser ? JSON.parse(savedUser) : { username: 'User', email: 'user@example.com', phone: '', address: '' }; }); const [isEditing, setIsEditing] = useState(false); const [formData, setFormData] = useState({ username: user.username, email: user.email, phone: user.phone || '', address: user.address || '', currentPassword: '', newPassword: '', confirmPassword: '' }); const handleChange = (e) => { const { name, value } = e.target; setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, [name]: value })); }; const handleSubmit = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); // In a real app, you would send this data to an API // For now, we'll just update the local state and localStorage const updatedUser = { ...user, username: formData.username, email: formData.email, phone: formData.phone, address: formData.address }; setUser(updatedUser); localStorage.setItem('user', JSON.stringify(updatedUser)); setIsEditing(false); // Password change would be handled separately in a real app }; return (
